snippet: Kamayev, 52, a former director of the agency, known as Rusada, apparently had a heart attack. The agency’s founding chairman, Vyacheslav Sinev, died Feb. 3.
abstract: Nikita Kamayev, former director of discredited Russian antidoping agency Rusada, unexpectedly dies; he and agency's founding chairman Vyacheslav Sinev, who also died unexpectedly on Feb 3, had both resigned after World Anti-Doping Agency reported systematic, state-backed sports cheating in international competitions.
lead_paragraph: Kamayev, 52, a former director of the agency, known as Rusada, apparently had a heart attack. The agency’s founding chairman, Vyacheslav Sinev, died Feb. 3.

headline.main: Nikita Kamayev, Ex-Head of Russian Antidoping Agency, Dies
headline.print_headline: A Second Ex-Official of Russia’s Antidoping Agency Dies
